alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 9:15AM CDT until April 20 at 12:15PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Pickens and Sumter Counties. .Flooding continues on the Tombigbee River and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by late tonight, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. At 128.0 feet, Cattle in the area should be moved to higher ground. Flooding of some cabins and camps along the river can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 125.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 PM CDT Monday was 125.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 112.8 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
